text.tspan: Monthly average ocean heat content in the top 700 meters
Ocean heat content is measured relative to the 1971â€“2000 average, which is set at zero for reference. It is
measured in 10Â²Â² joules. For reference, 10Â²Â² joules are equal to approximately 17 times the amount of energy
Data source: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information - Heat Content Monthly Basin Time Series (2025)
